Scilab function

NAME

    show_graph - displays a graph

CALLING SEQUENCE

nw = show_graph(g[,win,wdim,wpdim])

PARAMETERS

    • g : graph list
    • win : scalar or string. If it is a number, it gives the graphics window number to be used for graph drawing. If it is a string it can be "new" to create a new graphics window for graph drawing or "rep" if the current graphics window is to be used and the previous graph is to be cleared.
    • wdim=[w,h] : graphics window internal dimensions (just as in xset("wdim",w,h) ).
    • wpdim=[w1,h1] : graphics window external dimensions (just as in xset("wpdim",w1,h1) ).

DESCRIPTION

    show_graph displays the graph g in a specified (or in the current) graphics window. If there is no current graphics window, it is created.

EXAMPLES

    ta=[1 1 2 2 2 3 4 5 5 7 8 8 9 10 10 10 11 12 13 13 13 14 15 16 16 17 17];
he=[2 10 3 5 7 4 2 4 6 8 6 9 7 7 11 15 12 13 9 10 14 11 16 1 17 14 15];
g=make_graph("foo",1,17,ta,he);
g("node_x")=[283 163 63 57 164 164 273 271 339 384 504 513 439 623 631 757 642];
g("node_y")=[59 133 223 318 227 319 221 324 432 141 209 319 428 443 187 151 301];
show_graph(g,2);
show_graph(g,1,[500,500],[300,300])

SEE ALSO

    scigraph show_arcs show_nodes xset
